elements.title: History taking, physical examination and selection and /or interpretation of investigations
elements.description: focussed data gathering, efficient and accurate examination, guided by information from history taking, orders appropriate investigations and/or reviews and incorporates findings into differential diagnosis

elements.title: Diagnosis and management plan
elements.description: makes diagnosis decisively after thoroughly considering alternatives, devises appropriate management plan

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Communication and listening skills
elements.description: uses open questions, limits interruptions, language is tailored to needs of patient, establishes patient trust, provides explanations suitable to patient’s level of understanding, avoids confusing medical jargon, adapts to patient’s needs and preference

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Engages support staff when needed
elements.description: minimises barriers by engaging interpreters or other members of health care team to facilitate effective communication

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Professionalism and time management
elements.description: introduces self, respectful, uses structured approach, effective use of time, adjusts consultation to circumstances, provides patient-centred care

elements.title: Specific feedback
elements.description: Consultant comments on what was done well and provides suggestions on how the trainee may improve. Not all boxes need to be completed.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Trainee would benefit from observation and feedback on a similar case.

elements.name: Outcome_Question
elements.title: Overall rating
elements.description: Consultant discusses the details of the casewith the trainee, including how the trainee may have responded to alternatecircumstances. Overall, which describes the competence of the trainee for thistype of case?

choices.text: Required frequent guidance: Trainee required frequent prompting, teaching and re-direction when discussing important aspects of the case.
Required occasional guidance: Trainee required occasional prompting and teaching when discussing the case.
Safe and competent: Trainee discussed the case thoroughly and responded well when questioned about rationale and potential scenarios.
Role model for others: Junior colleagues would learn from discussing cases with this trainee, can provide guidance to others.
